answers.answer: You might be sensitive to diet issues.  My sister swears that wheat gluten is bad for some people.  You might drop in at a library or a natural foods store and see if there are any guides on checking yourself for food sensitivities.

They probably are all related and are likely linked to a poor digestive system.  It could be caused by food allergies/intolerances.Did the doctor do any bloods?  Did he test your iron levels and stores?  Sometimes women need to have higher stores than the ranges state as normal.  For example if the range for iron is 20-350 and a woman is 30.  Then this seems okay but actually needs to be higher ie 50-70 for her to stop feeling tired.With the thrush you might need some probiotics.  I've suffered from 'mild' thrush for the last 3 years.  After a month on probiotics I realised that I'd missed the next round of thrush.You may want to go to a naturopath and get some guidance from them.  You likely have some gut damage which means that you aren't absorbing nutrients properly.You may also want to go back to your doctor and get a blood test for coeliac disease.  This is basically an allergy to gluten and it damages your gut.Get some testing done first before you cut stuff out of your diet.  And you probably want to do diet stuff under the care of a health professional like a naturopath or dietician.

question: I have suffered from vaginal thrush infections for nearly 4 years now. I often get cystitis. I have to eat very often or I get hypoglyemic. I am often tired and anxious. I also get very bloated and suffer from bad wind problems that affect my social life...Apart from this I am healthy. I have been tested for diabetes, HIV/AIDS and STDs and have none.  I weigh 53kg and am 169cm so I am not overweight and I am only 24 years old.The doctor says these symtoms aren't related. But surely there is an underlying reason that links them?
title: Thrush, cystitis, hypoglemia, wind...
